title: The Advocates
body:
A sweeping look at the history and causes of Los Angeles' current homeless crisis, and an intimate view of the tireless work of advocates who strive to create better lives for their homeless clients. This critically acclaimed feature documentary premiered at the 2018 Los Angeles Film Festival and went on to be screened at multiple film festivals and released theatrically. The film is an integral part of United Way’s Everyone In Campaign to end homelessness in Los Angeles, and part of the core curriculum for social studies at UCLA.

Executive Producer
Caroline Schweich

Director
Rémi Kessler

Available on
Amazon Prime, Vimeo, You Tube

title: Shadows and Lights. Orson Welles
body:
A documentary about Orson Welles, the legendary figure who reinvented the language of theatre and cinema at the age of 24, this film opened the Classic section of the Cannes Film Festival in 2015.

Executive Producer
La Compagnie des Phares et Balises

Director
Elizabeth Kapnist

title: Voyage of the Continents, North America
body:
A series of scientific documentaries exploring the history and rise of the Earth's continents.

Executive Producer
La Compagnie des Taxis Brousse

Director
Alexis de Favitsky

title: The Fabulous History of the Hollywood Studios
body:
A six-part series on depicting the history of Hollywood’s studios (Paramount, Universal, MGM, Warner, 20th Century Fox and RKO) through behind-the-scenes life stories of the men who built them.

Executive Producer
Adamis

Director
Jimmy Leipold, Xavier Blano
